docs.title: NEXUS AI Terminal Assistant
docs.text: Production‑ready, secure, multi‑model AI for your terminal. Switch between Google Gemini, Groq, Ollama (local), HuggingFace, ChatGPT (OpenAI), and MCP with one CLI, enriched by security controls, utilities, and an extensible modular architecture.

docs.title: Highlights
docs.text:
• Multi‑Model Switching: gemini, groq, ollama, huggingface, chatgpt, mcp
  • Local AI via Ollama: list and select installed models with specs
  • Secure by Default: input sanitization, safe command allowlist, file boundary checks
  • Powerful Utilities: web search, sysinfo, notes, timers, unit conversions, quick weather
  • Developer Tools: code review assistant, refactor helper, TODO extractor, Git helpers
  • Productivity Suite: tasks manager, themes, reminders, analytics, games & learning
  • Cross‑Platform: Windows, macOS, Linux

docs.title: Developer Guide
docs.text: We welcome contributions to NEXUS AI! This guide will help you set up your development environment and understand the project structure.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9+
  • Git

docs.title: Installation from Source
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/KunjShah95/NEXUS-AI.io.git
cd NEXUS-AI.io

  2. Create a virtual environment (recommended): 

    python -m venv venv
# Windows
venv\Scripts\activate
# macOS/Linux
source venv/bin/activate

  3. Install dependencies: 

    pip install -r requirements.txt

  4. Configure environment: Copy .env.example to .env and add your API keys. 

    cp .env.example .env

  5. Run the application: 

    python terminal/main.py

docs.title: Contributing Workflow
docs.text:
1. Fork the repo on GitHub.
  2. Create a branch for your feature or fix: 
    git checkout -b feat/your-feature-name
  3. Make your changes. Ensure code quality and add tests if applicable.
  4. Commit your changes: 
    git commit -m "feat: add new feature"
  5. Push to your fork: 
    git push origin feat/your-feature-name
  6. Open a Pull Request on the main repository.

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8 guidelines for Python code.
  • Use meaningful variable and function names.
  • Add comments and docstrings where necessary.

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
Run unit tests to ensure your changes don't break existing functionality.

python -m pytest terminal/tests/

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.9+
  • Internet access for cloud models (Gemini/Groq/HF/ChatGPT/MCP)
  • Optional: Ollama installed and running for local models

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Choose the option that fits your environment.

docs.title: Option A: One‑click OS scripts (Recommended)
docs.text:
We provide a single canonical installer per platform under dist/.

  • Windows: dist/install_windows.bat
  • macOS: dist/install_mac.sh
  • Linux: dist/install_linux.sh

Before running an installer, verify the SHA256 checksum in dist/SHA256SUMS.txt.

docs.title: Option B: From source (For Development)
docs.text:
# Clone
git clone https://github.com/KunjShah95/NEXUS-AI.io.git
cd NEXUS-AI.io

# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Configure environment
cp .env.example .env   # set your API keys; see below

# Run
python terminal/main.py

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Create and edit a .env file at the project root with the following variables:

GEMINI_API_KEY=...
GROQ_API_KEY=...
HUGGINGFACE_TOKEN=...
OPENAI_API_KEY=...
MCP_API_KEY=...

Ollama

Ollama does not require an API key but must be installed and the daemon running.

Per‑user config and data files live in: - Windows: %USERPROFILE%\.nexus - macOS/Linux: ~/.nexus

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Launch the terminal:

python terminal/main.py
  • Type /help to see the full command catalog.
  • Switch models anytime with /switch [model] (e.g., /switch groq).
  • Use /ollama-models to list your local Ollama models with specifications.

docs.title: AI Models
docs.text: NEXUS AI supports a wide range of AI models, allowing you to choose the best tool for the job.

docs.title: Supported Models
docs.text: Model Command Best For Gemini 2.0 Flash /switch gemini General tasks, coding, analysis. Google's fastest and most capable model. Groq Mixtral /switch groq Speed-critical tasks. Ultra-fast inference. Ollama Local /switch ollama [model] Privacy, offline use. Run models locally. HuggingFace /switch huggingface Research, experimentation. Access to open-source models. ChatGPT /switch chatgpt Creative writing, analysis. OpenAI's conversational AI. MCP Protocol /switch mcp Advanced integrations. Model Context Protocol.

docs.title: Switching Models
docs.text:
You can switch models at any time using the /switch command.

/switch gemini
/switch groq
/switch ollama llama3

docs.title: Checking Status
docs.text:
To see which model is currently active:

/current-model

To list all available models:

/models

docs.title: Ollama Integration
docs.text:
Ollama allows you to run large language models locally.

  1. Install Ollama: Download from ollama.ai.
  2. Pull Models: Run ollama pull [model_name] in your terminal (e.g., ollama pull llama3).
  3. Use in NEXUS:
    • List models: /ollama-models
    • View specs: /ollama-models [name]
    • Switch: /switch ollama [name]

docs.title: Core Commands
docs.text:
• /models — List available AI backends and states
  • /current-model — Show the active model and description
  • /switch [model] — Change model (e.g., /switch gemini)
  • /ollama-models — Summary table of installed Ollama models
  • /run <safe-cmd> — Run allowlisted commands
  • /sysinfo — OS, CPU, memory, disk stats
  • /websearch <query> — Quick DuckDuckGo search
  • /weather <city> — Current weather
  • /note <text> and /notes — Quick note and list
  • /timer <seconds> — Countdown with notification
  • /calc <expr> — Evaluate math expressions safely
  • /convert <val> <from> <to> — Quick unit conversions

docs.title: Security
docs.text: NEXUS AI is designed with security as a core priority.

docs.title: Security Model
docs.text:
• Input Sanitization: Blocks dangerous patterns and suspicious Unicode characters to prevent injection attacks.
  • Safe Command Allowlist: The /run command only executes allowlisted commands.
    • No shells, pipes, redirection, or wildcards are allowed.
    • File arguments are enforced to be within the current directory boundary.
  • API Key Validation: API keys for major providers are validated for correct format.
  • Local Data Storage: Configuration and user databases are stored per-user in ~/.nexus with restricted permissions where supported.

docs.title: Security Commands
docs.text: Command Description /encrypt [message] Encrypt messages /decrypt [message] Decrypt messages /rotate-key [service] [key] Rotate API keys /biometric-auth [data] Biometric authentication simulation /secure-password [len] Generate cryptographically secure passwords /security-report View security report /threat-scan [text] Scan text for security threats

docs.title: Reporting Issues
docs.text: If you discover a security vulnerability, please refer to SECURITY.md in the repository for reporting instructions.

docs.title: Task Management System
docs.text: NEXUS AI includes a built-in task management system to help you stay organized directly from the terminal.

docs.title: Basic Operations
docs.text: Command Description Example /task add [title] [description] Add a new task /task add "Fix bug" "Login issue" /task list List all tasks /task view [id] View task details /task view 1 /task update [id] [field] [value] Update task field /task update 1 status completed /task delete [id] Delete a task /task delete 1 /task complete [id] Mark task as completed /task complete 1

docs.title: Advanced Features
docs.text:
• Priority: Set task priority (low/medium/high)
    • /task priority [id] [level]
  • Categories: Organize tasks by category
    • /task category [id] [category]
  • Due Dates: Set deadlines
    • /task due [id] [YYYY-MM-DD]
  • Subtasks: Break down complex tasks
    • /task subtasks [id] [subtask]
  • Search & Filter: Find what you need
    • /task search [keyword]
    • /task filter [criteria]

docs.title: Tools
docs.text:
• Export/Import: /task export [json/csv], /task import [file]
  • Statistics: /task stats
  • Categories List: /task categories
  • Overdue/Today: /task overdue, /task today
